title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
Join us to Improve Health Equity for 5 Million People!

CareMessage is the technology non-profit building the largest patient engagement platform for low-income populations in the United States. Powered by the Health Equity Engine™, the platform enables organizations to combine messaging, data, and interoperability to increase access to care, improve clinical outcomes, and address social drivers of health.

With 20 million patients reached since 2013, CareMessage is the only patient engagement solution proven to improve health equity at scale. The team, many with lived experiences in these communities, leverages a nonprofit model to reinvest revenue into impact. CareMessage is the partner of choice for organizations committed to advancing health equity.

CareMessage is seeking a talented and experienced Senior DevOps Engineer to join our team. As a Senior DevOps Engineer at CareMessage, you will create and maintain a highly scalable and reliable Google Cloud Platform (GCP) infrastructure utilizing industry best practices. Are you excited about the opportunity to make a significant social impact by automating and building an infrastructure that powers a health equity engine messaging millions of underserved patients every month?

In this position, you will play a key role in the development of automation, security, and scalability in our infrastructure. Example projects may include: improving our already solid infrastructure to support continued growth, identifying areas for reducing security risks, enhancing developer workflows and deployment speeds, and optimizing performance to continually improve CareMessage and the product we provide our customers.


Requirements
  • Multiple years of experience in at least three professional roles as a DevOps Engineer, Infrastructure Engineer, Site Reliability Engineer, or similar Systems Administrator role
  • Strong Linux system administration skillsProficiency in one or more development languages, preferably Ruby or Python
  • Extensive experience maintaining production infrastructures on Google Cloud Platform, AWS or Azure ( GCP strongly preferred as we use GCP)
  • Experience with configuration management and automation tools (e.g., Terraform, Ansible)
  • Professional experience with software containers (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes)
  • Experience working with relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL)
  • Knowledge of and experience developing infrastructure that adheres to HIPAA security and compliance standards (experience with additional healthcare security frameworks is a bonus)
  • Familiarity with CI/CD tools like Jenkins and CircleCI

    • Nice to have:
  • Experience with firewall network appliances


    • Job Responsibilities
  • Lead engineering projects from start to finish, where the beginning scope is somewhat understood
  • Design, implement, and continuously improve our cloud infrastructure and related processes with a focus on automation, security, and creating a highly available, self-scaling redundant infrastructure
  • Develop and maintain backup mechanisms for production environments and test disaster recovery procedures
  • Participate in the on-call rotation, assist with triaging and resolving production issues, and respond to incidents
  • Assist engineering team members in using our infrastructure and automation services and solutions
  • Collaborate with engineering, leadership, and cross-functional teams to meet business goals
  • Mentor and provide feedback to team members and other engineers
  • Stay up to date on best practices, new technologies, and relevant industry trends
  • Build and secure our multi-tenant environments across software, processes, and infrastructure
  • Automate and deploy a self-scaling, redundant infrastructure


    • Within 1 Month You'll:
  • Be able to complete a demo of our product and walk through our infrastructure
  • Become familiar with our backlog of projects tied to scalability and security
  • Begin developing automated infrastructure setup scripts


    • Within 3 Months You'll:
  • Understand the CareMessage product development process and key policies and procedures
  • Participate in the on-call rotation and assist with triaging alerts
  • Demonstrate understanding of how to recover our infrastructure according to our disaster recovery plan
  • Develop and deliver solutions for monitoring, availability, performance, analytics, and security


    • Within 6 Month You'll:
  • Identify areas of opportunity for improvement, contribute to our backlog, and deliver solutions
  • Have delivered security enhancements and automated manual processes
  • Play a critical role in ensuring our 24x7 availability and recovery capabilities, addressing production issues as necessary
  • Contribute to strategic improvements in our development infrastructure

    This role is currently set at an L3 DevOps Engineer level, equivalent to someone who has held two or more DevOps Engineering roles with multiple years of experience and is highly proficient in their craft.

    Our salary allocation for this role is $165,000

    Note: If you don’t fit this description perfectly (in particular, if you come from an under-represented group) but have held a Data Science role in the past, please apply!

    We believe in equal work for equal pay. All team members performing the same role at the same level are paid the same regardless of where they are in the world. 

    Working at CareMessage

    We take care of our employees by offering competitive salaries and benefits packages. We ensure our team feels cared for so that we, in turn, can help support our safety net organizations and underserved populations.

title: Business Analyst
description:
Mission Lane is revolutionizing access to credit to pave a clear way forward for millions of Americans on the path to financial success. By attracting top-tier talent and leveraging cutting-edge technology, we’re redefining consumer credit for the better. Sound like a mission you can get behind?

We’re seeking a data-driven problem solver with sharp analytical skills and a strong customer focus to join our Collections & Recoveries team as a Business Analyst.

The impact you’ll make in this role:

You’ll play a key role in shaping and advancing our Loss Mitigation strategy through rigorous analytics across credit, product, and operations—grounded in a sensitive and sensible approach that puts our customers at the center.

You’ll take real ownership of solving delinquency-related challenges, uncovering actionable insights, influencing strategy, and driving meaningful change for both our customers and our business.

Along the way, you’ll gain exposure to industry veterans across finance, product, and software engineering and sharpen your skills across credit, analytics, operations, and technology.

As a Business Analyst on the Collections & Recoveries team, you will:

  • Package quantitative and qualitative insights into clear, concise business cases to influence leadership and drive real outcomes.
  • Leverage a combination of data, technology and customer-back thinking to deliver key initiatives that enable our customers and our business to succeed.
  • Work closely with partners across Product, Credit, Finance, Engineering and Operations to understand the current state and identify opportunities to improve economics, customer experience, risk, and efficiency.
  • Continuously analyze current business and operational data and processes to identify improvement opportunities. Learn fast and act like an owner by proactively seeking out information and solving complex problems.
  • Leverage analytical findings to build best-in-class C/R capabilities in areas like Segmentation, Offer Strategy, Contact Strategy & Operational Infrastructure to best serve delinquent/charged off customers in resolving their debt and improving their financial lives.

You’ll thrive in this role if you have:

  • 3+ years analytics experience in the Financial Services industry
  • Hands-on experience with A/B testing
  • Proficiency in SQL for data exploration and analysis
  • Strong quantitative, analytical, problem-solving, and conceptual thinking skills
  • A genuine passion for diving into data and uncovering insights
  • A problem-solver mindset with the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly and effectively
  • Sharp business intuition—you know how to grow a channel, prioritize what matters, and navigate trade-offs in a fast-moving, resource-constrained environment
  • A strong sense of ownership and hustle—you work hard, move quickly, and make things happen
  • Excellent presentation skills—you know how to turn data into clear, compelling stories for diverse stakeholders
  • Comfort operating in a dynamic, fast-paced environment

Compensation

Annual full-time base salary range:  $94,000 - $143,000

Additional compensation in the form(s) of participation in our annual incentive program and equity are dependent on role.  Pay is based on factors such as work experience, education, certification(s), training, skills, and competencies related to the role. Mission Lane also offers a comprehensive benefits plan, which includes unlimited paid time off, 401(k) match, a monthly wellness stipend, health/ dental/ vision insurance options, disability coverage, paid parental leave, flexible spending account (for childcare and healthcare), life insurance, and a remote-friendly work environment.

About Mission Lane:

Founded in December 2018, Mission Lane is a purpose-driven fintech company based in the U.S., with headquarters in Richmond, Virginia. 

It all started with a realization:  nearly fifty percent of the adult population in the U.S. doesn’t have access to a clear line of credit. Most traditional credit card companies either overlook or overcharge this group because they have less-than-perfect credit scores or no scores at all. We decided this just wouldn’t do.

In partnership with our sponsor banks, we offer credit cards under the Mission Lane brand name, with better, clearer terms, and a more refined customer experience than the alternatives available to people working hard to improve their credit.

To date, over three million consumers have chosen Mission Lane, earning high customer ratings on Credit Karma for its market segment and industry leading Net Promoter scores. 

Mission Lane has cumulatively raised over $600 million of equity from leading investors, including Invus Opportunities, QED Investors, LL Funds, funds affiliated with Oaktree Capital Management, and other leading investors.

Interested in learning more? Check out The Mission Lane Junction for articles on culture, credit, and community, and The Mission Lane Newsroom for media mentions.

At Mission Lane, we’re committed to a workplace built on respect and dignity, where everyone has the opportunity to contribute. We believe diversity in all forms makes us stronger, and we intentionally foster an inclusive environment where employees feel valued, respected, and free to be their true selves. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected status.

title: Strategic Partnerships Manager

We are seeking a seasoned Strategic Partnerships professional to grow our platform partnerships. You will be responsible for securing and managing large, strategic one-to-many Partnerships to drive GMV, Revenue, and Merchant Acquisition. As an individual contributor on our expanding Strategic Partnerships team, you will focus on signing and scaling our largest Strategic Partnerships in collaboration with Affirm’s cross functional teams. 

The ideal candidate is an experienced strategic thinker and self-starter who is eager to learn, comfortable with ambiguity, and thrives in a challenging, fast-paced environment. You are comfortable working across various internal and external partner teams and can autonomously drive strategic solutions for Affirm and its partners. This role involves managing complex deal cycles, GTM and partner enablement, forecasting, and driving Affirm adoption through platforms. Your work will directly impact top-priority, company-wide goals.

  • Identify and target a list of key strategic platform partners, lead negotiations and related contract terms, and sign mutually beneficial one to many platform partnerships deals 

  • Work across various internal and external cross functional teams to create and execute against compelling commercial and technical partnership frameworks

  • Launch, scale, and grow signed partners via active partner management and in collaboration with internal and external XFN teams

  • Manage platform pipeline development, develop standardized deal and partner management process and stay organized across internal systems

  • Excellent communication, presentation, writing (proposals, memos, e-mail), strategic and structured thinking, organization and project management skills, ability to manage multiple projects/tasks concurrently

  • Fast learner who seeks out new opportunities, drives progress, and navigates ambiguity

Pay Grade - M

title: Mid Level, Front End Engineer
description:

Joining INGENIOUS.BUILD means embarking on an incredible journey to create the first cloud application for managing the entire lifecycle of a real estate construction project. You'll be building what some consider the holy grail of construction project management. We value teammates who think beyond their “part,” who want to understand the why behind the work, and collaborate to find the best path forward.   • Someone proactive who brings fresh ideas and energy to the team
  • A developer with grit and a drive to tackle tough challenges

Skills and Experience needed:

Benefits of Working with Us:

title: Senior Analytics Engineer
description:
About Mixbook  

Mixbook is the #1 rated photo book service in the US, with over 30K 5-star reviews, empowering over 6 million people to design and share their one-of-a-kind stories. We're a profitable, growing company known for our intuitive design platform, exceptional quality, and fanatical customer service. But Mixbook is more than just a product - we're a team of passionate individuals driven to make a difference.

What truly sets Mixbook apart is our commitment to creating a workplace where you can thrive both personally and professionally. We value collaboration, open communication, and a growth mindset. We believe in empowering our team members to take ownership, embrace challenges, and make a meaningful impact.

Our culture is built on a foundation of trust, constructive feedback, and a shared passion for delivering outstanding results. If you're looking for a place where your contributions are valued, your voice is heard, and you can grow alongside a talented team, then Mixbook is the place for you.

Senior Analytics Engineer

Mixbook is more than just a place to work - it's a community where creativity, collaboration, and data-driven decisions fuel our mission to empower human connection. Our Analytics team powers that mission, developing insights and delivering data infrastructure that drives decisions across every part of the business.

We're looking for a Senior Analytics Engineer to help us rebuild and scale our analytics foundation. You’ll focus on modeling clean, reliable data in dbt, transforming it into Looker dashboards the business can trust, and defining core metrics used across teams. This role is ideal for someone who can balance hands-on technical execution with a strategic mindset and thrives in an environment where the foundation is still being built.

Our current stack includes: Redshift, dbt, Looker, Metaplane, Optimizely, Mixpanel, and GA4.

Location: Remote. Requires early-morning meetings (as early as 6am PST) to collaborate with our Eastern European engineering team.

What You'll Do
  • Drive Business Performance: Own and maintain executive-level dashboards, ensuring the data models (LookML and dbt) behind them are accurate and scalable.
  • Unleash the Power of Data: Develop and refine data models to support Mixbook’s growth. Move us from ad-hoc structures to a more robust, sustainable environment for deeper analysis.
  • Transform Our Data Organization: Build repeatable, scalable solutions and guide end users on leveraging these data models for self-service analytics and consistent reporting.
  • Champion Data Governance: Establish uniform definitions for key metrics, maintain data quality standards, and implement governance frameworks that ensure confidence in our data.
What You'll Need
  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a quantitative field (eg, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Finance, Mathematics).
  • 4+ years of proven experience in Analytics or Data Engineering.
  • Expert proficiency in SQL and LookML - you’ve built and optimized complex data models in Looker.
  • Proven track record with dbt - delivering modular, tested transformations for analytics.
  • Experience with Business Intelligence tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau) and an ability to design intuitive, user-friendly data visualizations.
  • Success in fast-paced, high-growth environments.
  • Comfortable introducing new analytic techniques and driving their adoption across teams.
Bonus Points
  • Background in B2C eCommerce.
  • Experience with Python (including statistical modeling libraries).
  • Familiarity with building or maintaining a semantic layer in a data stack.
Why Mixbook?
  • Comprehensive healthcare coverage, including fully covered premiums for you and your family.
  • Unlimited PTO (plus vacation bonuses!) and flexible schedules.
  • $2,000 per year for external learning and development.
  • 401k + match, company-wide events, travel opportunities, and more.
Our Mission & Culture

At Mixbook, our mission is to empower people to be creative and connect deeply with the ones they love. Unlike most growth companies, we have invested deeply in culture—because we believe that when we love our people, they will love our customers, and our customers will love our business. 

You'll contribute to a product loved by millions and help people create lasting memories. You'll thrive in a healthy culture that values collaboration, growth, and open communication. title: Manager, Implementation
description:
We’re Quandri, our mission is to unlock the world’s insurance data so brokerages and agencies can best serve their clients. Our Renewal Intelligence Platform is designed to help brokerages save time, increase profitability, and drive better outcomes for their staff, clients, and business. 

We saw 3x ARR growth last year and have plans to continue to grow both revenue and our team this year. Named one of LinkedIn’s Top Canadian Startups in 2024, we have already made a big impact on the insurance industry. However, what matters most is making our customer’s lives better one renewal at a time. We want you to be a critical part of that journey! We’re a hybrid company, with ⅔ of our team in Vancouver and the rest distributed. For those in Vancouver, we have an office in Gastown that we expect people to be at three days a week. We understand both the advantages of some flexibility around personal lives, and the positive interpersonal effects of in-person collaboration.

Running a profitable personal lines book of business is harder than ever for insurance brokerages. Market conditions, rising costs, talent shortages, and staffing constraints are just some of the challenges that hinder profit margins, scalability, and exceptional client service. Trusted by 5 of Canada’s top 10 brokerages, Quandri is transforming the renewal process with AI-driven automation, enabling proactive workflows and delivering data-driven insights.

Today’s renewal process is often reactive, with brokers focusing on clients who request help rather than adopting a proactive, data-driven approach. Quandri is revolutionizing renewals by offering a platform that uses AI and automation to streamline operations. This allows brokerages to retain more business, enhance client and staff experiences, reduce E&O risk, and boost sales through upselling and cross-selling.

Looking to make an impact in your next role? How about transforming an entire industry? At Quandri, we’re unlocking new frontiers in insurance. To do that, we model our culture as a crew of interstellar astronauts. As Quandronauts, we’re committed to building a company that is diverse and multi-faceted. We’ve raised venture capital from top US and Canadian investors to help us achieve our mission, and are now scaling to achieve this.



About the Role: 

Implementation is a key differentiator for Quandri and a critical part of the customer journey. As the Manager of Implementation, you will play a hands-on role in leading customers through successful onboarding and implementation experiences. You’ll manage and support a small but growing team, refine our implementation process, and help drive key outcomes across customer experience, time to value, product adoption, and operational efficiency.

This is a great opportunity for a customer-focused, process-oriented leader who enjoys rolling up their sleeves and has experience executing implementation strategies in high-growth SaaS environments—ideally within AI, ML, or automation technologies.


What you’ll do:

  • Hire, mentor, and grow a high-performing implementation team
  • Build, maintain, and execute quarterly plans aligned with business objectives
  • Develop, monitor, and manage key performance metrics
  • Leverage a data-driven approach to building and optimizing scalable implementation strategies that drive efficiency and improve customer experience
  • Collaborate with senior leaders across Quandri to achieve organizational and company goals
  • Collaborate with sales and post-sales teams to ensure a seamless transition throughout the customer journey
  • Identify and mitigate risks associated with implementation projects, proactively addressing challenges to ensure successful outcomes
  • Foster a culture focused on delighting customers and maximizing adoption of Quandri's solutions

  • +5 years of professional experience leading Implementation within a technical B2B SaaS product or AI technology companies
  • +3 years of people management experience
  • Experience building implementation processes from the ground up
  • The ability to work closely with our product team to develop implementation process and assets for new to market products
  • Experience hiring and managing implementation teams
  • Proven track record of success in establishing and scaling implementation processes
  • A data-driven approach to developing, tracking and optimizing performance metrics
  • Self-motivated, detail-attentive, action-driven with the ability to take initiative, execute, and follow-through
  • Highly effective communicator with good people instincts - able to build trust and work well with a diverse group inside and outside the company
  • Eager for a hands-on role, where you'll be asked to directly lead some implementations while we continue to grow the team

    • Bonus points if you have:

    • Our guiding principles:
  • Customers at the core. We put the customer at the center of all we do. At a basic level, we believe business success comes down to talking to customers and building something they want. We don’t listen to customers and just take what they say blindly, but we think critically about it and build what they need. Customers are the core of everything we do, and our business exists to serve them. We prioritize their needs over all else within the company.
  • Move with urgency. There are times when we need to move slowly and deliberately, but we default to acting fast and with urgency. We slow down when necessary, but this should be a deliberate choice. Businesses become more lethargic as they grow, this principle is designed to fight this fact.

Don’t take someone’s word for it or the answer “because that’s how we do it.” Understand why and dig deep.

  • Act like an owner.  We’re all owners of the business and act like it. We follow through on commitments, own our results and think long-term.

  • Competitive compensation which is dependent on level of experience, performance and choice of stock option compensation

title: Lead Designer
description:
About Exygy

Exygy is a digital innovation studio on a mission to build resilient and healthy communities. We enable impact-focused organizations to rethink experiences and create digital products that solve their problems and delight users. Our diverse team brings a breadth of technical expertise, user-centric perspectives, and product strategy to every engagement. As a certified B-Corporation, we are driven by our fierce commitment to the betterment of humanity. Our clients include CARE International, QURE Healthcare, San Francisco Mayor's Office of Housing, and Hopelab. Exygy has embraced a work from home philosophy and we are now a remote-first company. This role can be located anywhere in the U.S and may occasionally require traveling for meetings or team building events.
Exygy remains connected and engaged with virtual team events, weekly all hands meetings and regular zoom workshops and training.

Summary

Exygy seeks an enthusiastic, experienced, and creative Lead Designer who is passionate about making a difference in the world with design and technology. Join our tight-knit and growing product team to build out CiviForm, a platform that makes it easier to access and administer public benefits. While you’ll be focused on CiviForm, you’ll also be a member of Exygy’s design team, learning from and collaborating with peers on our Consultancy and Bloom businesses. This is a full-time remote position.

CiviForm is an open-source software collaborative and digital public good, co-owned and directed by the governments who use it. This role is an exciting opportunity to drive a new chapter in the platform’s design and work directly with local and state governments to hone a key piece of infrastructure through which they speak and deliver services to their residents.   As Lead Designer on CiviForm, you will be responsible for setting the design strategy, mentoring other designers, and collaborating with product managers and engineers in all phases of the design process - from research to delivery and consistent, agile improvement. You will lead the creation of design assets that adhere to human-centered design principles. To support feature delivery, you will drive the governance of our design system, which helps the design and engineering teams be more effective and collaborative in delivery. This system includes themeable design tokens, a shared component library, and supporting documentation. You will also be a thought leader on the team, helping to establish and advocate for design best practices. CiviForm’s users are government administrators, benefits navigators, and residents—often members of underserved and underrepresented communities. Ensuring the final user experience is accessible, impactful, and equitable is essential to our approach to building.


Responsibilities
  • Collaborating on the strategy for CiviForm: Work with the product team and design leadership to define the design strategy, aligning our design decisions with our sustainability goals and product priorities, across both the core platform and individual government feature roadmaps.
  • Lead design solutions: Lead the creation of engaging and impactful UX and UI design solutions that successfully articulate the vision and goals of a product and solve users’ pain points. Including sitemaps, user journeys and flows, service blueprints, wireframes, clickable prototypes, and visual mockups.
  • Evolving CiviForm’s design process: Collaborate closely with engineering and product partners to improve design and developer handoff and QA processes. Partner with other design leads across business lines to establish and refine best practices and design methodologies at Exygy. 
  • Onboarding and design management: Help onboard and mentor staff designers and short-term design fellows to CiviForm's design strategy and delivery process so they can be effective. Activities include design reviews, QA, and weekly 1:1’s.
  • Conducting research and discovery: Partner closely with design researchers to conduct qualitative and quantitative user research to gain insights into applicant and government partner goals, motivations, and challenges. Activities may include stakeholder-facing workshops (design sprints, co-design workshops), user interviews, and synthesizing and presenting findings. 
  • Ensuring accessibility and usability: Advocate for accessibility standards and inclusive design principles through visual guidelines and UX best practices. In partnership with design researchers, conduct user research and testing (surveys, usability evaluations, accessibility evaluations).
  • Maintaining our design system: Build and maintain CiviForm’s design system (built on USWDS) to support new product features (including auditing, creating new components or patterns, accessibility checks, and documentation)


    • Required Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities:
  • Demonstrated knowledge of human-centered design principles and processes, from discovery and ideation to design and iteration.
  • Professional experience in civic tech, affordable housing, and/or social impact work.
  • Expert knowledge of Figma and additional design software (eg, Dovetail, Miro, and Google Workspace)
  • Demonstrated ability to articulate and justify design strategy as it relates to solving human problems.
  • Mentor more junior designers and collaborate with peers on UX/UI design best practices to complement each other's skill sets and fill any identified skill gaps.
  • Strong collaboration abilities, along with a flexible and friendly approach to working with teams.
  • A focus on both a macro and micro level in terms of design details.
  • The ability to give and receive constructive feedback well to improve and develop.
  • An interest in developing skills (design principles, tools, and trends) and sharing knowledge with fellow peers and community members.
  • Comfortable working within an agile development process.
  • Knowledge of equitable design processes and mindsets, how to make sure our products are truly equitable
  • Experience designing solutions for underserved populations, such as those navigating social safety networks
  • Experience working with and navigating a set of complex government stakeholders
  • Knowledge of web accessibility best practices and standards for government websites 
  • Experience with or knowledge of public sector design systems (such as US Web Design System, Gov.UK)
  • Knowledge of building content strategy and best practices for government websites (such as plain language, reading levels, multilingual content, and content governance) 
  • Experience building a government content management system


    • Education and Experience:
  • Degree in Design or equivalent experience required; 7+ years of hands-on professional experience as a Product/UX and UI Designer
  • An online portfolio that demonstrates experience with UX Design across multiple verticals and platforms (mobile/web/desktop) is required (if you don’t have a portfolio, you can send us links or PDFs for designs you have created and be ready to provide context/more information about them)

Education Perfect is an EdTech platform designed to empower educators and amplify their impact in the classroom. We aim to enable teachers to personalise learning at scale with a range of powerful learning, assessment, and insights tools, helping them and their students reach their full potential.

As an EPeep, you’ll work on projects that have a real impact on students' lives and have the freedom, support and resources you need to develop your skills and grow your career.

We are hiring a Languages Generalist Editor to help create high-quality, engaging language learning resources for our customers on the EP platform. In this role, you will collaborate with our content team to edit, review and publish content while ensuring it meets EP’s Design and Quality standards. You will also work across teams to support content maintenance, improve internal processes and resolve context-related issues to enhance the overall learning experience.

This is a fixed term contract until December 2025 and we are open to candidates all across New Zealand.

What you will do

  • Build, edit and peer-check Languages content to ensure EP Design and Quality standards are met
  • Manage graphic design requests/briefings and application to resources in collaboration with the Project team and Design Team
  • Collaborate on Languages content initiatives contributing to the evolution of EP Design and Quality standards
  • Support the Senior Quality Editor & Global Languages Lead with publishing content and managing Learning Pathways on the EP platform
  • Support with essential operational tasks such as managing audio and media for Languages resources and editing teacher documentation
  • Support with the updating and maintenance of all Languages content at the request of the Global Languages Lead or feedback channels
  • Respond to Languages-specific content queries or fixes from teachers and EP Staff via the feedback channels across the company

About you

  • Proven subject matter expertise in language teaching, preferably in the following languages: Chinese, Italian, Spanish, Indonesian and/or EAL, with an understanding of pedagogy and instructional design needs
  • Strong attention to detail to ensure our instructional design standard is reached
  • Confident in providing training and feedback to content team members as required
  • Ability to communicate effectively and maintain professional relationships with  project teams
  • A team player who can collaborate within a cross-functional environment
  • Willingness to multi-task and switch between different content priorities as required
  • A continuous improvement mindset, always looking for opportunities to improve ways of working 
  • Highly adaptable and agile approach, with the ability to deliver quality results
  • Excellent time-management skills and the ability to work independently 
  • Excellent written English, grammar and spelling
  • Relevant experience in editing, publishing or digital content creation

Equitable opportunities, growth, and development lie at the heart of how we work at EP. We understand that not all applicants may possess all the following attributes so if you think you have what it takes, but are not sure you check every box, we would love to still hear from you!

What we offer

  • As our team is based globally, we offer both remote and flexible working arrangements
  • Three extra days of annual leave during our end of year shut down period
  • EAP with unlimited sessions
  • Employee referral program - $2000 when you refer a new team member
  • Ongoing professional development, including opportunities to develop your career into other areas of our business and access to EPs Learning Hub 
  • EP support groups - Mana Wahine, DEI, Environmental Impact and Wellness Committees
  • The opportunity to work within a growing global business with Diversity Works accreditation, Carbon Net Zero BCorp status, Digital Promise certification, and an unwavering commitment to our mission, people, and community

We celebrate individuality, value diversity, and understand that flexible and remote work opportunities enable our team members to work in a way that fosters creativity and inspires individual brilliance. When you work with us, you're not just joining a company - you're joining a team united by the desire to make a difference.

Education Perfect is an EdTech platform designed to empower educators and amplify their impact in the classroom. We aim to enable teachers to personalise learning at scale with a range of powerful learning, assessment, and insights tools, helping them and their students reach their full potential.

title: Global Recruitment Partner
description:

  • Competitive compensation, with benefits designed to support your well-being.
  • Opportunities for career growth and development in an exciting industry.

title: Senior Accountant
description:
Why We're Here:
At Brave Health, we are driven by a deep commitment to transform lives by expanding access to compassionate, high-quality mental health care. By harnessing the power of technology, we break down barriers and bring mental health treatment directly to those who need it most—wherever they are. As a community health-centered organization, we are dedicated to ensuring that no one is left behind. Nearly 1 in 4 people in the U.S. receive healthcare through Medicaid, yet two-thirds of providers don’t accept it. Brave Health is stepping up to close this gap by making mental health care accessible, affordable, and life-changing for all.

Job Description

Our Finance team is seeking a Senior Accountant to oversee daily accounting functions and lead the monthly close process. If you’re passionate about numbers and thrive in a mission-driven environment, we’d love to hear from you!

In this role, you will be a key player in our small department, handling monthly close journal entries, revenue recognition, payments, expense reports, bank reconciliations, accruals, and more. You will be the primary source of reporting each month. Additionally, you'll manage activities related to accounts payable and receivable, and help maintain internal controls. Payroll support and related compliance will also be part of your responsibilities, along with addressing ad hoc issues and questions. You’ll own the financial books and ensure accurate reporting to FP&A and the wider organization. 

As we mature our accounting function, you’ll also be integral in tackling new challenges, so we’re looking for someone who enjoys exploring different areas and solving problems creatively. The ideal candidate should be able to approach problems from various perspectives and is comfortable adapting to change. You should be highly organized, detail-oriented, and able to handle confidential information responsibly. Precision is key, and you have a knack for spotting errors quickly. Excel is your go-to tool, and you thrive in a fast-paced environment. Your analytical mindset drives your natural curiosity, but you maintain a positive, proactive attitude toward change.

You must also be an effective communicator—able to break down complex concepts, listen, ask questions, and collaborate well with others. Most importantly, you enjoy working closely with teammates and sharing responsibilities to ensure everything is properly accounted for.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Oversee and maintain the general ledger, ensuring all transactions are recorded accurately and in a timely manner

  • Prepare and analyze monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements in accordance with accounting principles

  • Perform reconciliations of all balance sheet accounts

  • Lead and manage the month-end and year-end closing processes, ensuring timely and accurate completion.

  • Oversee the preparation and filing of taxes, including 1099s, and ensuring compliance with local, state, and federal tax regulations.

  • Monitor and implement internal controls to ensure the accuracy and integrity of financial data 

  • Coordinate annual FS audit and support the timely delivery of audited financial statements 

  • Continuously evaluate and recommend improvements to accounting processes and systems for increased efficiency.

Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 5 years of senior level in-house accounting experience at a startup

  • Solid understanding of US GAAP and accrual accounting principles

  • Ability to adapt quickly in a dynamic environment

  • Strong Excel and Google Sheets skills

  • Experience with Quickbooks required

  • Experience managing external auditor relationships

  • Familiarity with Netsuite or similar software

  • Familiarity with BambooHR or similar HRIS/Payroll systems

  • Familiarity with Ramp preferred

Brave Health is very proud of our diverse team who cares for a diverse population of patients. We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage all applicants from every background and life experience to apply.

title: Sr. Staff Product Manager - Federation Core
description:
Are you an experienced product manager excited to work with developer tools that help the biggest companies around the world scale in production with GraphQL? As a Product Manager at Apollo, you’ll provide platform engineers with the tools, capabilities, and controls they need to deploy, operate, and scale Apollo’s Federated GraphQL runtime layer.

In this position, we’re seeking an accomplished Product Manager with a highly technical acumen and understanding of API’s, query languages, and algorithms. As a specialized Product Manager working on the foundational library for API federation and query planning, you’ll collaborate with Product, Engineering, and Design to provide platform engineers with the tools, capabilities, and controls they need to integrate their API ecosystem and efficiently and reliably query it. 

So join us and help shape the future of GraphOS!


What You'll Do
  • Define and drive Apollo’s vision for how APIs are federated and queried.
  • Own and evolve Apollo’s ability to provide API query planning insights across the development lifecycle, from a developer’s IDE to production, through common federation tooling. 
  • Build and evangelize a roadmap across internal and external stakeholders.
  • Develop and validate new GraphOS capabilities directly with industry-leading customers, such as Paypal, Wayfair, Peloton, The New York Times, and many others.


    • What You Bring
  • You have successfully led product development lifecycles and technical product management, ideally with developer platforms and infrastructure or similar B2B products.
  • You have deep experience with APIs and algorithms.
  • You understand how to work back from the customer’s perspective to identify value and develop a clear product vision.
  • You are adept at reasoning technical tradeoffs in relation to the product vision you’ve built.
  • You like learning and proactively keeping up with new developer trends by reading books, watching videos, taking classes, or doing something similar.
  • You possess a strong entrepreneurial drive and leadership skills.
  • You’re excited about GraphQL and modern developer tooling and are interested in helping push the industry forward.


    • Nice to Have
  • Degree in Computer Science or related field
  • 8+ years of experience in Product Management within the developer tooling space
  • Direct experience with GraphQL, API middleware, or scaled API platforms.

We make hiring decisions based on your skills, experience, and our overall assessment of what we learned during the hiring process. We are open to hiring these positions at a Staff Product Manager to Sr. Staff level, based on fit. The accompanied salary range covers these levels.

    In addition to the U.S. base salary range, we also provide equity and benefits. Apollo offers all U.S. employees a choice of 3 Anthem Blue Cross medical plans and California residents can also choose from an additional 2 Kaiser medical plans. Dental and Vision benefits are provided by Sun Life Financial.

title: Events Marketing Manager
description:
About Ramp

Ramp is a financial operations platform designed to save businesses time and money. Combining corporate cards with expense management, bill payments, vendor management, accounting automation, and more, Ramp's all-in-one solution frees finance teams to do the best work of their lives. More than 30,000 companies, from family-owned farms to e-commerce giants to space startups, have saved $1B and 10M hours with Ramp. Founded in 2019, Ramp powers the fastest-growing corporate card and bill payment platform in America, and enables over 35 billion dollars in purchases each year.

Ramp's investors include Sequoia, Founders Fund, Thrive Capital, Khosla Ventures, Greylock, Stripe, Goldman Sachs, Coatue, and Redpoint, as well as over 100 angel investors who were founders or executives of leading companies. The Ramp team comprises talented leaders from leading financial services and fintech companies—Stripe, Affirm, Goldman Sachs, American Express, Mastercard, Visa, Capital One—as well as technology companies such as Meta, Uber, Netflix, Twitter, Dropbox, and Instacart.

Ramp has been named to Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies list and LinkedIn's Top U.S. Startups for over 3 years, as well as the Forbes Cloud 100, CNBC Disruptor 50, and TIME Magazine's 100 Most Influential Companies.

About the Role

As a key member of the Field & Events team, you will manage Ramp’s presence at conferences, trade shows, and industry events to drive awareness, demand, and revenue. In this role, you will take the lead in selecting, scoping, planning, and executing our pre, post, and during-event presence at various activations across the country. 

You will work closely with Sales and Marketing teams to refine Ramp’s field strategy for conferences and tradeshows, taking charge of our third-party event calendar. Responsibilities include logistics, staff training, booth production, and budget management.

This high-impact role requires creative thinking, hands-on project management, and collaboration across functions to drive Ramp's growth.

What You’ll Do

  • Own and execute Ramp’s third-party (3P) direct events strategy in partnership with the Field & Events team leaders to reach ideal customers.

  • Manage end-to-end event campaigns, from vetting to post-event analysis and pipeline tracking.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure messaging, promotion, deliverables, and tactics align with event goals.

  • Own lead generation and pipeline targets.

  • Partner with the Sales team and other key stakeholders to align event goals and post-event learnings.

  • Collaborate with Finance on budget, pipeline, and resource forecasting.

  • Provide onsite event management as needed (travel required multiple times per quarter).

What You’ll Need

  • 2+ years experience in demand generation / sales pipeline building for tech organizations, including some B2B experience

  • Expertise in field or event marketing

  • Exceptional event management, project management, budget management, and reporting experience

  • Strong organization and communication skills.

  • Business acumen with a focus on quantitative goals.

  • Self-starter with the ability to adapt in rapidly changing environments.

  • Ability to make decisions and recommendations in ambiguous situations.

  • Ability to travel multiple times per quarter.

Nice to haves

  • Event marketing experience for Finance or FinTech

  • Production agency experience

For candidates located in NYC or SF, the pay range for this role is $96,000 - $176,750. For candidates located in all other locations, the pay range for this role is $86,400- $159,050.

 

Benefits (for U.S.-based full-time employees)

  • 100% medical, dental & vision insurance coverage for you

  • Fertility HRA (up to $5,000 per year)

  • WFH stipend to support your home office needs

  • Wellness stipend

  • Parental Leave
